intro: Monopsis lutea, commonly known as the yellow monopsis, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Monopsis lutea is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and relatively easy care requirements.
